specs.title: Default language
specs.description:
Default display language.
Important: The engine and the core modules support listed languages, but it is possible that not all the installed modules do. In such case, the fallback language will always be English/United States.

specs.title: Engine enabled
specs.description: Emergency switch to issue an all systems halt. Only administrative functions will work.

specs.title: Email sender name
specs.description: Name of the sender for delivery of email notifications and messages.

specs.title: Email sender address
specs.description: Email address used to deliver notificacions and messages

specs.title: reCAPTCHA secret key
specs.description:
Secret key provided by Google Recaptcha. Used to protect the engine from automated accounts creation among other things.
Visit Google reCAPTCHA to get your secret/site keypair or leave blank to disable reCAPTCHA functionality.

specs.title: reCAPTCHA site key
specs.description:
Public key provided by Google Recaptcha. Used in conjunction with the private key.
Leave blank to disable reCAPTCHA functionality.

specs.title: Alternate admin menu layout
specs.description:
By default, the admin menu is shown on a bar above the standard menu bar.
If this option is enabled, admin menu entries will be moved into the menu bar (yet they'll remain visible for admins only).

specs.title: Active template
specs.description: Template to use for all output.

specs.title: User levels
specs.description:
List of all user levels in the system.
User levels go from 0 to 255. You can add as many levels as needed to identify your user types using the next syntax: level - name, E.G. 100 - Author.
Warning: There are 8 roles tied to specific levels: 0 - Unregistered, 1 - Unconfirmed, 50 - Newcomer, 100 - Author, 150 - VIP, 200 - Moderator, 240 - Coadmin and 255 - Admin.
You must keep these levels in the list and just change their names as needed. Plus, add any levels between them.

specs.title: User online cookie
specs.description:
Name of the cookie to store the session account id on the user's browser.
Change it to force users with an open session to re-authenticate.

specs.title: User session cookie
specs.description:
Name of the cookie to store the account id on the user's browser so the user doesn't need to login every time.
Change it to force all users (online/offline) to re-authenticate.
